statement: Solve the system \(x + y + z = a\), \(x^2 + y^2 + z^2 = b^2\), \(xy = z^2\). Give conditions on \(a\) and \(b\) so that \(x, y, z\) are distinct positive numbers.
Let \(a, b, c\) be the sides of a triangle and \(T\) its area. Prove \(a^2 + b^2 + c^2 \geq 4\sqrt{3} T\) and determine when equality holds.

In triangle \(P_1P_2P_3\) with interior point \(P\), lines \(P_1P, P_2P, P_3P\) meet opposite sides at \(Q_1, Q_2, Q_3\). Prove that among \(P_1P/PQ_1, P_2P/PQ_2, P_3P/PQ_3\) at least one is \(\leq 2\) and at least one is \(\geq 2\).

Construct triangle \(ABC\) given \(AC = b\), \(AB = c\) and \(\angle AMB = \omega\) (\(\omega < 90^{\circ}\)), where \(M\) is the midpoint of \(BC\). Prove a solution exists iff \(b \tan(\omega/2) \leq c < b\) and determine when equality holds.

Given non-collinear points \(A, B, C\) on one side of plane \(\varepsilon\), take arbitrary points \(A', B', C'\) in \(\varepsilon\). Let \(L, M, N\) be midpoints of \(AA', BB', CC'\) and \(G\) the centroid of triangle \(LMN\). Find the locus of \(G\) as \(A', B', C'\) vary independently in \(\varepsilon\).
